name: Henry Young

topics.response_text: This isn't a good time. My daugher, C.J. is missing.

topics.topic: MS03RCHistory1Could I ask you about Rivet City's history?
topics.topic_text: What do you know about Rivet City's history?
topics.response_text: Hmm... Despite all my time working here, I've got no clue. Seagrave Holmes is about the only person I know who's more familiar with the place.

topics.topic_text: Where can I find Ted Strayer?
topics.response_text: Have you tried the common room?  That's where he sleeps.

topics.topic: RCTopicCJYoungMissingHave you seen C.J. Young lately?
topics.topic_text: I found C.J. She was on the lower deck with James Hargrave.
What is this I hear about the Hangar Deck and Upper Deck?
topics.response_text: We do the best we can to take care of everyone on the Hangar Deck.

conversation.response_text: Shall we go for a walk on the flight deck tonight, dear?
Yes, Doctor Li. I've recalibrated with them.

description:
Henry Young is a 48 year-old Caucasian Male.

Henry Young is a dedicated handyman living in Rivet City with his wife Christie and daughter C.J. He's responsible for maintaining the structural integrity of the settlement, a task that keeps him busy with repairs and maintenance. Despite his demanding schedule, he's a devoted family man who takes pride in his work and his loved ones.

Henry Young's Personality: Hardworking, responsible, family-oriented, traditional, and somewhat frustrated with what he perceives as a lack of work ethic among some Rivet City residents. He is a devout believer whose faith anchors his family life and guides his moral compass.

Henry Young's Backstory: Born in the pre-War suburbs of Washington D.C., Henry survived the Great War by taking shelter in a robust cellar. After emerging to find the world devastated, he traveled for years, honing his skills as a repairman and mechanic. He eventually settled in Rivet City, finding a community in the massive aircraft carrier. There, he met his wife Christie, and together they raised their daughter C.J. Their family is known for their devout faith, attending services at the Rivet City chapel every Sunday.
